Neurodivergent.

This is because neurodivergent individuals often have unique cognitive and sensory experiences that can affect their ability to eat and digest food. For example, some neurodivergent individuals may have difficulty with sensory integration, which can make it challenging for them to eat and digest food. Additionally, neurodivergent individuals may have difficulty with executive functioning, which can affect their ability to plan and prepare meals. However, with proper support and accommodations, neurodivergent individuals can still eat and digest food successfully.
